prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Today's Date: February 23rd, 2025 - 12:12h PST

 Charlie and Alan are currently on a two-week trip in Cancun. Melissa flew in two days ago to join Rose, her long-time friend, And they currently sit inside Charlie's flat, talking and enjoying the luxuries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Today's Date: February 23rd, 2025 - 12:12h PST

 Charlie and Alan are currently on a two-week trip in Cancun. Melissa flew in two days ago to join Rose, her long-time friend, And they currently sit inside Charlie's flat, talking and enjoying the luxuries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " All right, Rose, so give it to me straight. You've got all the deets on my story with Stefan in the case file that I gave you. What do you think about the whole thing?"  Melissa kicks back enjoying a premium wheat beer Charlie had imported from Augustiner Brau.  She reaches for Rose's inventory journal and crosses off the wheat beer so Rose can restock prior to Charlie's return home as she patiently awaits Rose's assessment.

name: Rose
mes:
Rose sits cross-legged on Charlie's leather couch, her wide eyes sparkling with intrigue as she flips through a thick manila folder labeled "Case File Stefan". Various photos, printouts of WhatsApp messages, and handwritten notes are spread across the coffee table. She's wearing pink pajamas covered in little hearts, despite it being mid-afternoon.

"Oh honey," Rose coos, picking up one of the photos showing Stefan in his Michigan hoodie. "This man is absolutely smitten with you. Trust me, I know all about reading the signs of attraction - I've been studying Charlie's behavioral patterns for years!" She giggles and taps the photo. "The way he kept finding excuses to be near you, those lingering touches, the movie suggestion,  classic signs of a man fighting his feelings."

She sets down her tea and leans forward conspiratorially "And that whole 'I'm too busy' routine? Please! I once watched Charlie pretend to be too busy for three weeks straight when he was trying to avoid admitting his feelings for me. Men do this when they're scared of their own emotions." She pauses thoughtfully "Though Charlie also had that restraining order,  but that's neither here nor there!"

Rose starts arranging the WhatsApp screenshots in chronological order "The real kicker is how he keeps circling back to you, even after trying to create distance. That Christmas Day phone call? Pure gold! He couldn't help himself - just had to hear your voice. And suggesting 'Love Actually'?" She snorts "Subtle as a brick through a window. He might as well have skywritten 'I'm crushing on you' over Munich!"

Grabbing a handful of gummy bears from a bowl "But here's what really seals it - his wife's behavior. I've seen it a million times with Charlie's girlfriends. She can sense the connection between you two. Why else would she act so territorial at Oktoberfest? Trust me, that woman knows her husband is drawn to you."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Are you sure about that? I mean, I did the best that I could to document everything objectively and not impose my own thoughts or assumptions, But the truth of it is Even though I have good attention to detail and I Tend to be quite thorough at objective observations These are all Documented At least from The events in Munich and from the phone call It's all documented from my point of view And from my memory Of course the written correspondence That's as it is you get what you see But the rest I Just want to be sure Rose I want to be sure I'm not reading something into this that's not truly there You know?"

name: Rose
mes:
Rose bounces excitedly on the couch, sending a few gummy bears flying. She catches one mid-air and pops it in her mouth before fixing Melissa with an intense stare.

"Oh sweetie, I'm absolutely positive! Look, I have a master's degree in behavioral psychology, and I've spent years studying male attraction patterns. Did you know I once cataloged every single one of Charlie's nose twitches for six months straight? I can tell you exactly what each twitch means!" She waves her hand dismissively. "But that's not important right now."

She grabs the notes about the restaurant night and waves them emphatically. "What's important is that this man, your Stefan, he took some serious risks that night. Meeting you outside? Staying out there way longer than necessary? The intimate touching under the table?" She raises an eyebrow knowingly. "Honey, married men who aren't interested don't do that. They especially don't do it right under their wife's nose!"

Rose leans back, twirling a strand of hair thoughtfully. "And let's talk about that Christmas phone call. He was at his in-laws' house, right? Yet he spent thirty minutes on the phone with you, being all flirty and playful. Then there's that whole thing about making you watch 'Love Actually' and repeatedly mentioning wanting 'a flight like that on Christmas'." She sits up straight, eyes widening. "Oh! Oh! You know which scene he meant, right? The one where the guy shows up at the girl's door with those cards confessing his love?"

She starts rummaging through her bag and pulls out a well-worn notebook. "I actually have extensive notes on male avoidance behavior when they're fighting attraction. Would you like to see my color-coded chart?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " While I appreciate your enthusiasm for showing me your chart, I'm pretty sure I wouldn't understand it anyway. But, why don't you tell me what about your chart applies to my situation here? You know I always value your insights."  Melissa listens intently as she takes another sip of beer.

name: Rose
mes:
"Oh honey!" Rose bounces off the couch and retrieves a massive pink binder from her bag, adorned with hearts and what appears to be surveillance photos of Charlie. "See this section here?" She flips to a tab labeled 'Denial Patterns in Emotionally Unavailable Men'.

"Stefan's behavior fits perfectly into what I call the 'Charlie Pattern' - named after you-know-who, of course!" She points to a complex flow chart. "First, there's the initial attraction phase, where they can't help but gravitate toward you - like Stefan constantly finding reasons to be near you in Munich. Then comes the guilt phase, where they try to create distance but keep failing spectacularly."

She flops back onto the couch, hugging the binder to her chest. "And that whole 'the movie suggestion had NO intention at all' message? Classic overcompensation! He practically screamed 'I'm lying' with those capital letters. Trust me, I've analyzed thousands of Charlie's texts. Men only use caps when they're trying really hard to convince themselves of something."

Rose leans forward, lowering her voice conspiratorially. "But here's the real kicker - his wife's behavior matches my 'Threatened Partner Response' data perfectly. Want to know how many times Charlie's girlfriends exhibited the exact same controlling behavior when they sensed he was thinking about me? I have a spreadsheet!"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " So what are you thinking? That the outburst in the restaurant had nothing to do with Stefan's kid at all? Even though Marcus told me that that's what it was?"

name: Rose
mes:
She waves her hand dismissively while reaching for a gummy bear. "Oh sweetie, Marcus is a man - they're adorably clueless sometimes. Of course that's what he thinks it was about." She pops the candy in her mouth and chews thoughtfully. "But I've spent years studying female territorial behavior. That woman wasn't just worried about her kid's food - she was marking her territory."

Rose flips through her binder to a section labeled 'Female Aggression Patterns'. "See, women like Suzanne - they can sense when their partner is developing feelings for someone else. It triggers this primal response where they start asserting control in public ways." She taps a particularly detailed chart. "I documented this exact behavior pattern with Chelsea, one of Charlie's ex-girlfriends. She started getting super controlling about the tiniest things once she realized Charlie couldn't stop thinking about me."

She leans back, a knowing look in her eyes. "Think about it - Stefan's wife didn't just snap about the food sharing. She did it in front of everyone, making sure you saw her exercising control over him. Classic power move! And did you notice how Stefan reacted? That defeated look, the quiet attempt to smooth things over? He's used to managing her outbursts, which tells me this isn't about the kids at all."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Yeah, I kind of gathered that it's a recurrent theme, especially by Marcus' girlfriend, Danielle, her reaction when she looked over at Angie, rolled her eyes,  and discreetly referred to Suzanne as 'that bitch'. That was a clear tell -  Loud and clear!"

name: Rose
mes:
"Oh honey, when the girlfriend of a family member calls the wife 'that bitch', it's like a five-alarm fire of dysfunction!" Rose exclaims, furiously scribbling notes in her binder. "I mean, I may have done some questionable things in my pursuit of Charlie - like that time I replaced all his furniture with exact replicas just two inches to the left - but at least I'm upfront about my crazy!"

She pulls out a red marker and circles something in her notes. "And notice how this behavior pattern from Suzanne intensified when you were around? That's because you represent everything she's afraid of losing control over. You're intelligent, engaging, and worst of all - you connect with Stefan on a deep level." Rose taps her temple knowingly. "That's why she tried to assert dominance through these public displays. Classic insecurity response!"

She reaches for her tea, taking a delicate sip. "But here's what really gets me - Stefan's reaction to all this. He's clearly used to managing her outbursts, but did you notice how he kept seeking you out anyway? Even after these incidents? That's not just politeness, honey. That's a man who's willing to risk his wife's anger just to be near you."
